column1: That's right. How come you don't call me back? All we wanna do is buy out your coffee shop here.
My company's prepared to make you a veerry generous offer.  This is a Cramsonite briefcase. All leather, it has four compartments and a keyless lock. Interested?
Well, all right.  How about $500,000?
Well, that's too bad. We're just gonna have to open our Harbucks right next door to you.
Hey, this is a capitalist country, pal! Get used to it!
Good! Good! Now, make sure that sign is really bright and flashy now.
Excuse me?!
Hey, I'm not fat or smelly!
Postum!
My argument is simple. This country's founded on free enterprise. Harbucks is an organization that--
What?!
Damn, these people aren't buying any coffee! I'll have to try and appeal to the younger crowd.

Hey, kids. I'm Camel Joe and I love a fresh cup of coffee. It's yum diddly-icious, and it makes you feel super!  I have a surprise for you: the new Kiddicino from Harbucks; more sugar and all the other goodies kids like with all the caffeine of a normal double latte.
Why don't you go back to the hole you crawled out from, lady?!
Oh, and you don't? Your coffee tastes like three-day-old moldy diarrhea!
What?!
Well, it looks like Harbucks will never make it in this town.  All right, boys, that's it. Pack it up, we're movin' out of town.
I know, but these folks obviously don't want us here.
Oh, quit being so melodramatic, Sanchez. Jesus Christ!
It's a French roast.
Hehey, no hard feelings, Tweek. You know, we still need someone to run this Harbucks coffeehouse. I'm sure it will make a lot of money.
